info.displayName: P. falciparum (3D7) chromosomes sequence and annotation
info.description: Sequence data from GeneDB for P. falciparum 3D7 chromosomes in EMBL (sequence and annotated features) format generated at the Wellcome Trust Sanger Institute. The new annotation for P. falciparum 3D7 genome started in October 2007 with a weeklong workshop co-organized by staff from the Wellcome Trust Sanger Institute (WTSI) and the EuPathDB team. The Wellcome Trust and Burroughs Wellcome Fund-sponsored workshop was held in Hinxton, UK and was attended by nearly 30 Plasmodium researchers contributing expertise in various aspects of Plasmodium biology, plus more than 10 bioinformatics support staff from the Artemis, GeneDB and EuPathDB teams. Ongoing annotation and error checking is being carried out by the GeneDB group from WTSI.

info.displayName: P. falciparum (3D7) chromosomes sequence and annotation

The Wellcome Trust and Burroughs Wellcome Fund-sponsored workshop was held in Hinxton, UK and was attended by nearly 30 Plasmodium researchers contributing expertise in various aspects of Plasmodium biology, plus more than 10 bioinformatics support staff from the Artemis, GeneDB and EuPathDB teams. Ongoing annotation and error checking is being carried out by the GeneDB group from WTSI.

info.description: DBRefs for Entrez gene links.

info.displayName: DBRefs for Phenotype db links
info.description: Phenotype links from Genetically Modified Rodent Malaria Parasites: Pberghei.eu hosts a database containing information on genetically modified rodent malaria parasite lines generated by many labs worldwide. Specifically, it contains data of three rodent malaria parasite species; Plasmodium berghei, P. yoelii and P. chabaudi. The aim of this database is to provide the research community access to detailed information on the generation (e.g. disruption, tagging, mutation, transgene expression) and phenotype of genetically modified malaria parasites. The database not only provides information on 'successful' mutants with a clear phenotype, but also (un)published mutants without a clear phenotype and (un)published negative trials to disrupt genes.

AND g.na_feature_id = t.parent_id AND t.na_feature_id = taf.na_feature_id"

info.displayName: EC mappings from Ginsburg
info.description: Enzyme classification (EC) mappings to P. falciparum genes supplied by Hagai Ginsburg (Hebrew University), July 2009.

info.displayName: P. falciparum protein interaction network
info.description: Protein interaction network for P. falciparum derived from yeast two-hybrid studies obtained from Doug LaCount (Purdue).

info.displayName: Phylogenetic profiles for P. falciparum
info.description: Phylogenetic profiles based on the presence or absence of all known P. falciparum ORFs in 164 completely sequenced genomes were calculated. Similarity between profiles is a good indicator of functional linkages between proteins (see Pellegrini et al., 1999). Data on ORFs with the most similar profiles to a given query ORF is also available, and can be used to establish the function of uncharacterized ORFs, based on the similarity of their profiles (see Date and Marcotte, 2003) with ORFs of known function.

info.displayName: Phylogenetic profiles for P. falciparum (mutual information scores)
info.description: Mutual information, an entropy based, information theoretic measure, was used to measure similarity between phylogenetic profiles. This measure is more sensitive, and can detect inverse or non-linear relationships, as opposed to using simpler metrics such as Pearson correlation (Date and Marcotte, 2003).

info.displayName: P. falciparum protein functional interactions
info.description: Using a number of computational and experimental functional genomics datasets, we have reconstructed the functional interaction network of the human malarial parasite P. falciparum. Network data and associated queries are available at the plasmoMAP website.

resource.pluginArgs: --sourceIdRegex ">(\w+)" --fastaFile @@dataDir@@/pfc.fasta --externalDatabaseName %RESOURCE_NAME% --externalDatabaseVer %RESOURCE_VERSION% --SOTermName 'EST' --ncbiTaxId 36329 --libraryStrain '3D7' --libraryStage 'Asexual stage' --libraryVector 'pOTB7b' --contactName 'Malcolm Gardner' --contactAddress1 'Seattle Biomedical Research Institute' --contactAddress2 '307 Westlake Avenue N., Suite 500 Seattle, WA 98109-5219' --libraryName 'Zhang/Gardner Pf 3D7 mixed asexual' --libraryDesc "CDNA was prepared from polyA+ RNA using the SMART cDNA Library Construction Kit and was cloned into the pOTB7b vector, a derivative of pOTB7 (1.8 kb) in which a SfiI stuffer fragment was inserted between the BamHI and XhoI sites of pOTB7.PFOCB48 indicates plate and well. T indicates dye terminator chemistry. F and R indicates M13 forward and reverse primers.The R primer is at the 3' polyA end of the mRNA."

info.displayName: Zhang/Gardner P. falciparum 3D7 mixed asexual stage ESTs
info.description: Hanbang Zhang and Malcolm Gardner P. falciparum 3D7 mixed asexual stage EST library.

resource.pluginArgs: --sourceIdRegex "\|(\w+\(\S+\))$" --fastaFile @@dataDir@@/reffull_pf.fas --externalDatabaseName %RESOURCE_NAME% --externalDatabaseVer %RESOURCE_VERSION% --SOTermName 'transcript' --ncbiTaxId 36329 --libraryStrain '3D7' --libraryVector 'pME18SFL3' --contactName 'Junichi Watanabe' --contactAddress1 "Institute of Medical Science; The University of Tokyo, Department of Parasitology" --contactAddress2 "4-6-1, Shirokanedai, Minatoku, Tokyo 108-8639, Japan" --putativeFullLength --libraryName 'derivedFromWatanabePf3D7_cultured' --libraryDesc "Predicted full length transcript sequence produced after BLAT alignment of the WatanabePf3D7_cultured EST library sequences to the genome and correction of the cDNA sequences using annotated gene sequences."

resource.unpack: dumpSequencesFromTable.pl --outputFile @@dataDir@@/PfalciparumChroms.fasta --idSQL "SELECT source_id,sequence FROM DoTS.ExternalNASequence ns, SRes.ExternalDatabase ed, SRes.ExternalDatabaseRelease edr WHERE ed.name = 'Pfalciparum_chromosomes_RSRC' AND ed.external_database_id = edr.external_database_id AND edr.version = '@@Pfalciparum_chromosomes_VER@@' and ns.external_database_release_id = edr.external_database_release_id"

resource.unpack: for f in `ls @@dataDir@@/data.exchange`; do cat @@dataDir@@/data.exchange/$f | adjustPlasmoEmblFile > @@dataDir@@/data.exchange/$f.fixed; cat @@dataDir@@/data.exchange/$f.fixed | perl -pe 's/MAL(\d+ standard)/Pf3D7_0$1/' | perl -pe 's/Pf3D7_01([01234] standard)/Pf3D7_1$1/' | perl -pe 's/(\/systematic_id="[^"]+)/$1_v5.5/' > @@dataDir@@/fixed/$f.fixed; done

info.displayName: P. falciparum (3D7) chromosomes annotation, PlasmoDB version 5.5
info.description: Sequence data from GeneDB for P. falciparum 3D7 chromosomes in EMBL (sequence and annotated features) format generated at the Wellcome Trust Sanger Institute, TIGR/NRMC, and Stanford University. This data has sequence updates for chromosomes 6, 7 , 8 and 13. For more information see the GeneDB 3D7 News Archive. Includes sequence updates to TIGR chromsomes 2, 10, 11 and 14. Originally described in Gardner et al. Nature 419:498, 2002. Also includes centromere features and curated Gene Ontology and E.C. number associations to genes.

info.displayName: insert P. falciparum old gene aliases from version 5.5

resource.pluginArgs: --externalDatabaseSpec "%RESOURCE_NAME%|%RESOURCE_VERSION%" --inputFile @@dataDir@@/gene_association.GeneDB_Pfalciparum.20080403 --goExternalDatabaseSpec "GO_RSRC|@@GO_VER@@" --seqIdSql "SELECT regexp_replace(g.source_id,'_v5.5$',''), taf.aa_sequence_id FROM dots.genefeature g, dots.transcript t, dots.translatedAAFeature taf WHERE g.na_feature_id = t.parent_id AND t.na_feature_id = taf.na_feature_id and g.source_id like '%v5.5'" --targetTable "DoTS::TranslatedAASequence" --lineOfEvidence "Annotation Center" --inputIdColumn id --tolerateMissingSeqs

info.displayName: P. falciparum protein GO associations
info.description: P. falciparum Gene Ontology associations assigned by GeneDB.

info.displayName: load Pf location map With Sqlldr
Pexel motif for P. falciparum protein export to the erythrocyte membrane.
info.description: A conserved pentameric sequence was shown to play a central role in protein export into the host cell and used to predict the exported proteome in P. falciparum.

info.displayName: HT motif for P. falciparum protein export to the erythrocyte membrane.
info.description: An 11-amino acid signal required for the secretion of proteins from the P. falciparum vacuole to the human erythrocyte was identified leading to a predicted secretome.

info.displayName: PlasmoAP motif for P. falciparum protein export to the apicoplast.
info.description: Putative apicoplast proteins in the P. falciparum genome were identified based on amino acid characteristics of transit peptides that target proteins to the apicoplast.
Broad SNP coverage, 2008-05-20

info.displayName: P. falciparum Evigan Gene Models
info.description: Evigan is a eukaryotic gene predictor which produces consensus gene models by integrating multiple sources of evidence. Evigan can incorporate various types of evidence such as gene models predicted by gene finders, EST matches, protein-to-genome alignment, etc. Employing a Dynamic Bayesian Network(DBN), Evigan makes predictions by infering the most likely consensus gene models given observed source evidence. Its model parameters are estimated by the Expectation-Maximization(EM) algorithm, eliminating the need of curated training data. Click here to get more information.

info.displayName: updating secondary score for evigan gene models
MAPP (Malaria Promoter Predictor)
info.description: MAPP (Malaria Promoter Predictor) recognises transcription start sites using 21 physicochemical properties of DNA. The predictor is comprised of a series of support vector machines which were trained on the 5' ends of full-length cDNAs from the FULL-Malaria database. Optimal prediction performance is achieved using only predictions with a MAPP score > 0.90. Predictions are strand specific. (Brick K, Watanabe J, Pizzi E).

info.displayName: load MAPP With Sqlldr
info.description: MAPP (Malaria Promoter Predictor) recognises transcription start sites using 21 physicochemical properties of DNA. The predictor is comprised of a series of support vector machines which were trained on the 5' ends of full-length cDNAs from the FULL-Malaria database. Optimal prediction performance is achieved using only predictions with a MAPP score > 0.90. Predictions are strand specific. (Brick K, Watanabe J, Pizzi E).

info.displayName: Pfalciparum Trans-factor binding sites from Manuel Llinas
SNPs from the Broad Institute
info.institution: The Broad Institute of MIT and Harvard
info.description: Based on whole genome sequence for strains Dd2 and HB3, and partial genome sequence for multiple strains

info.displayName: Isolate barcode data from Broad
info.description: The Genotyping Barcode is based on 24 different high frequency SNPs (minor allele frequency > 30%) in P. falciparum. These were selected from whole genome sequencing and affymetrix genotyping of P. falciparum strains from around the globe. The method itself uses the TaqMan SNP genotyping assay.

info.displayName: Isolate genotyping data generated from a 3k snp chip from Broad
info.description: The 3K genotyping chip is an affymetrix array containing ~3000 SNPs (about two thirds are from chromosome 7 and the rest are distributed throughout the genome).

info.displayName: Isolate genotyping data generated from a 75k snp chip from Broad
info.description: 75k SNP chip data from the Broad. There appear to be ~17500 informative snps.

info.displayName: Ghana1 and IT SNPs, Wellcome Trust Sanger Institute
info.description: Based on whole genome sequence for strains Ghana1 and IT

info.displayName: P. reichenowi SNPs, Wellcome Trust Sanger Institute
info.description: Based on whole genome sequence for P. reichenowi_Oscar

info.displayName: SNPs from all P. falciparum strains

info.displayName: P. falicparum Insertional mutagenesis from John Adams
IEDB Epitopes
info.description: IEDB epitopes.

info.displayName: IEDB Epitopes
info.description: IEDB epitopes.

info.displayName: RNA-Seqs from Patrick Duffy
ChIP-Seqs from Le Roch
P.falciparum RNA Sequence Profiles(Newbold)
info.description: Expression data for the P. falciparum RNA Sequence generated by the Newbold lab.

info.displayName: Chromatin Immunoprecipitation Microarray - Winzeler/Westenberger
info.description: ChIP-on-chip profiling of H3, H3K4me3, H3K9me3, and H3K9ac of P. falciparum from asynchronous parasites revealed an extensively euchromatic epigenome with heterochromatin restricted to variant surface antigen gene families (VSA) and a number of genes hitherto unlinked to VSA. Contact Henk Stunnenberg, h.stunnenberg@@ncmls.ru.nl, NCMLS Radboud Universiteit.

info.displayName: Chromatin Immunoprecipitation Microarray - Artur Scherf
info.institution: Unit de Biologie des Interactions Hte-Parasite
info.description: Chromatin immunoprecipitation to identify histone modifications (H3K9me3, H3K9Ac, H3K4me3, H4K20me3) in Plasmodium falciparum wild type and Sir2 knock-outs. Contact Artur Scherf, artur.scherf@@pasteur.fr, Unit de Biologie des Interactions Hte-Parasite.

info.displayName: Chromatin Immunoprecipitation Microarray - Till Voss
info.description: Genome-wide association of Pf Heterochromatin protein 1 (Hp-1) with virulence gene clusters. We identified 425 PfHP1-bound genes by ChIP-on-CHIP - almost all of which code for expor ted (predicted) virulence genes including all var genes, rifs, stevor, pfmc-2tm and others. Contact Till Voss, till.voss@@unibas.ch, for further information

info.displayName: Chromatin Immunoprecipitation Microarray - Winzeler/Westenberger
info.description: ChIP-on-chip profiling of H3, H3K4me3, H3K9me3, and H3K9ac of P. falciparum from asynchronous parasites revealed an extensively euchromatic epigenome with heterochromatin restricted to variant surface antigen gene families (VSA) and a number of genes hitherto unlinked to VSA. Contact Henk Stunnenberg, h.stunnenberg@@ncmls.ru.nl, NCMLS Radboud Universiteit.

info.displayName: Chromatin Immunoprecipitation Microarray - Artur Scherf
info.institution: Unit de Biologie des Interactions Hte-Parasite
info.description: Chromatin immunoprecipitation to identify histone modifications (H3K9me3, H3K9Ac, H3K4me3, H4K20me3) in Plasmodium falciparum wild type and Sir2 knock-outs. Contact Artur Scherf, artur.scherf@@pasteur.fr, Unit de Biologie des Interactions Hte-Parasite.

info.displayName: Chromatin Immunoprecipitation Microarray - Till Voss
info.description: Genome-wide association of Pf Heterochromatin protein 1 (Hp-1) with virulence gene clusters. We identified 425 PfHP1-bound genes by ChIP-on-CHIP - almost all of which code for expor ted (predicted) virulence genes including all var genes, rifs, stevor, pfmc-2tm and others. Contact Till Voss, till.voss@@unibas.ch, for further information

info.displayName: Pfalciparum 3D7 cell cycle expression data (Winzeler)
info.description: Cell cycle expression data for the P. falciparum 3D7 strain generated by the Winzeler lab (Scripps Research Institute).

info.displayName: Pfalciparum 3D7 gametocyte expression data (Winzeler)
info.description: Gametocyte expression data for the P. falciparum 3D7 strain generated by the Winzeler lab (Scripps Research Institute).

info.displayName: affymetrix array data on two Sir2 KO lines(Cowman)
affymetrix array data on Cowman InvasionKOs
Distinct physiological states of Plasmodium falciparum in malaria infected patients - expression profiles
info.description: To explore parasite in vivo biology we measured parasite steady state whole genome transcription using a previously reported custom made Affy array (Scrmalaria) based on the laboratory strain 3D7.

info.displayName: DD2 erythrocytic expression time series (DeRisi).
info.description: Expression data for the P. falciparum DD2 strain during the erythocytic stage generated by the DeRisi lab (UCSF).

info.displayName: 3D7 erythrocytic expression time series (DeRisi).
info.description: Expression data for the P. falciparum 3D7 strain during the erythocytic stage generated by the DeRisi lab (UCSF).

info.displayName: HB3 erythrocytic expression time series (DeRisi).
info.description: Expression data for the P. falciparum HB3 strain during the erythocytic stage generated by the DeRisi lab (UCSF). Described in Bozdech et al. PloS Biology 1:E5, 2003.

info.displayName: S8.4 vs. AH1S2 (Ring, Schizont, Trophozite) Expression Analysis
P.falciparum gene expression profiles (Newbold).
info.description: Plasmodium falciparum directly from the blood of infected individuals was cultured to examine patterns of mature-stage gene expression in patient isolates. Statistical estimation of cell-cycle progression and lineage commitment in Plasmodium falciparum reveals a homogeneous pattern of transcription in ex vivo culture, data provided by Chris I. Newbold, Weatherall Institute of Molecular Medicine, Molecular Parasitology Group.

info.displayName: E-GEOD-10022 array data(Su lab).
